items.q: Which civilization is credited with inventing writing, specifically cuneiform?
items.explanation: Sumer, located in Mesopotamia, used a stylus on clay tablets.

items.q: The Inquisition was a period of intense religious persecution initiated by the Catholic Church.
items.explanation: The Spanish Inquisition is the most infamous example, aiming to root out heresy.

items.q: Fidel Castro was forced out of power during the Bay of Pigs invasion.
items.explanation: The CIA-sponsored invasion in 1961 failed, and Castro remained in power.

items.q: What is the name of the treaty that formally ended World War I?
items.explanation: It placed heavy reparations and blame on Germany.

items.q: Who was the longest-serving US President, elected to four terms?
items.explanation: The 22nd Amendment later limited presidents to two terms.

items.q: What massive empire conquered Constantinople in 1453, ending the Byzantine Empire?
items.explanation: Under the leadership of Mehmed the Conqueror.

items.q: During which US historical era was alcohol illegal to sell or produce?
items.explanation: It was enforced by the 18th Amendment and lasted from 1920 to 1933.

items.q: What renowned general crossed the Alps with elephants to attack Rome?
items.explanation: This occurred during the Second Punic War.

items.q: What was the name of the intellectual and cultural movement in the 18th century emphasizing reason over tradition?
items.explanation: It heavily influenced the American and French Revolutions.

items.q: In 1917, what message from Germany to Mexico proposed a military alliance against the US?
items.explanation: Its interception and publication helped draw the US into WWI.
